intro: Blepharis pungens, commonly known as the needleleaf bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces seeds in capsule-like structures, which are dispersed by wind. Blepharis pungens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
